Content.Name: High Credit Restriction
Content.Title: Lifting High Credit Restriction
Content.BodyCopy:
Purpose of High Credit Restriction

The purpose of this restriction is three-fold: first, to help you create a graduation plan that will allow you to graduate in a timely manner and as efficiently as possible; second, to support the University's imperative to serve more students by allowing more students to attend BYU-Idaho; finally, it will help you honor your academic stewardship to use the Church's resources in the most effective and prudent way.


Process for Lifting a High Credit Restriction

To lift your high credit restriction hold, please complete a graduation plan as follows:  

  1. Go to https://web.byui.edu/gradplan/ to plan your remaining classes. Due to the number of credits you have earned, you may only plan classes required to earn your degree. (Step-by-step instructions and other helpful tools are included on this webpage should you need further assistance to complete your graduation plan.)
  2. When you are finished planning, click "Submit for Approval."
  3. Once you have submitted your plan, the Academic Discovery Center (ADC) for your major will review your plan. If changes are required, the ADC will contact you with instructions. If your plan is correct, it will be approved and the hold removed.
Grad Plans will be reviewed in the order they are received, and processing your request will take approximately two weeks. Making needed changes and adjustments to your Grad Plan will add to this time. 


Instructions for Creating a Semester by Semester Graduation Plan


Online Graduation Planning Tool:

A simple planning tool that allows you to look at your degree audit and drag and drop classes into semesters.

  • Go to https://web.byui.edu/gradplan/ or
  • Login to my byui.edu and select your blue STUDENT tab
  • Click on the grey tab on the left called DEGREE INFORMATION
  • Click on the blue link in the center of the page for GRADUATION PLANNER
  • This opens the graduation planning tool (you may have to download the SILVERLIGHT software if is not already installed on your computer)
  • Look over your degree requirements and drag and drop classes into the appropriate semesters and plan all of your classes until graduation
  • If a class is showing as INACTIVE, use the "Electives" tab to plan the appropriate class
  • Use the other sources in this document to make sure you have ALL your required courses planned (including clusters & minors if applicable) and planned on the correct semesters and meeting all pre-req's
  • If desired, you can view this YOUTUBE TUTORIAL: Graduation Planning Tool (if this link does not work, copy and paste the following link in an open browser: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dkl18usERfs&feature=youtu.be)

Other Helpful Tools:

Catalog:  The catalog contains all university requirements for every degree with specific class descriptions, prerequisites, and semesters when classes are offered.

  • Go to www.byui.edu
  • Scroll down and find CATALOG under the popular links. Click on CATALOG
  • Select the latest catalog year for class planning or your specific catalog year for your degree requirements
  • Scroll down to academic departments
  • Find your department/degree Ex: Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Architecture and Construction etc.
  • Scroll down to find degree information and specific class descriptions

Your Degree Audit:  The degree audit is used to show the classes required for you to graduate with your current declared major and minor/clusters.  The degree audit is organized with your personal information at the top, followed by any upper division classes you have taken.  It then shows all of the foundation requirements, followed by your major and minor/cluster requirements.
 
  • Go to your Mybyui.edu web page
  • Click on blue STUDENT tab
  • Click on the gray tab on the left labeled DEGREE INFORMATION
  • Click on the blue hyperlink View All Details
  • Click on the blue View PDF Degree Audit hyperlink
  • This should open a new window with your personal degree audit

Recommended Course Sequences:  The academic advising web page has recommended course sequences for most degrees.  This will show you the recommended sequencing that will work without any course sequencing, prerequisite, or wrong track issues.

  • Go to http://www.byui.edu/academic-discovery-center/students/academic-advising-and-class-planning/class-planning/recommended-course-sequences
  • This will take you to a list of all the academic colleges and departments
  • Click on the department that is over your major
  • Find your degree and catalog year; click on the blue catalog year hyperlink

Department Web Page:  Each department has their own individual official web page that contains information for their majors and some helpful flow charts and sequencing information.

  • Go to www.byui.edu
  • Click on the Directories link on the right
  • Select Colleges and Departments
  • Click on the department that is over your major
  • This will bring you to that department's web page where you can navigate to find specific information for that major including course offering schedules for certain classes that are not offered every single semester. BE SURE TO PLAN CLASSES ON SEMESTERS THEY WILL BE TAUGHT
